code: @Manual{,   title = {PEcAn.MAESPA: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis using MAESPA},   author = {Tony Gardella},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.7.5},   url = {https://pecanproject.github.io}, }

what: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis using MAESPA
title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis using MAESPA
text: PEcAn Functions Used Ecological Forecasts Reanalysis using MAESPA

title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis using MAESPA
text: can install development version PEcAn.MAESPA r-universe like : can install directly GitHub remotes package like : writing configurations files PEcAn.MAESPA uses Maeswrap package. recommend Maeswrap 1.8.0 later, can install GitHub remotes::install_github("RemkoDuursma/Maeswrap"). older version Maeswrap (1.7 writing September 2024) also available CRAN provide functionality PEcAn.MAESPA needs, version strong dependency rgl package, can hard install needed PEcAn. trouble installing extra dependencies annoyed unwanted plot window opening every time use PEcAn.MAESPA, try upgrading Maeswrap 1.8 later.
code: # Enable repository from pecanproject options(repos = c(   pecanproject = 'https://pecanproject.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) # Download and install PEcAn.MAESPA in R install.packages('PEcAn.MAESPA') library(remotes) install_github('pecanproject/pecan',  subdir = "models/maespa")

title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis using MAESPA
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

title: met2model.MAESPA — met2model.MAESPA
code: met2model.MAESPA(   in.path,   in.prefix,   outfolder,   start_date,   end_date,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: met2model.MAESPA — met2model.MAESPA
text: .path location disk inputs stored .prefix prefix input output files outfolder location disk outputs stored start_date start date data downloaded (use year part date) end_date end date data downloaded (use year part date) overwrite existing files overwritten verbose function verbose ... arguments, currently ignored

what: Code to convert MAESPA's output into netCDF format — model2netcdf.MAESPA
title: Code to convert MAESPA's output into netCDF format — model2netcdf.MAESPA
text: Convert MAESPA output NACP Intercomparison format (ALMA using netCDF)

title: Code to convert MAESPA's output into netCDF format — model2netcdf.MAESPA
code: model2netcdf.MAESPA(   outdir,   sitelat,   sitelon,   start_date,   end_date,   stem_density )

title: Code to convert MAESPA's output into netCDF format — model2netcdf.MAESPA
text: outdir Location MAESPA output sitelat Latitude site sitelon Longitude site start_date Start time simulation end_date End time simulation stem_density Number trees/plotsize. Values trees.dat

title: Code to convert MAESPA's output into netCDF format — model2netcdf.MAESPA
Write MAESPA configuration files — write.config.MAESPA
text: defaults list defaults process trait.values vector samples given trait settings list settings pecan settings file run.id id run

title: Write MAESPA configuration files — write.config.MAESPA
text: Requires pft xml object, list trait values single model run, name file create

title: PEcAn.MAESPA 1.7.5
text: model2netcdf.MAESPA longer writes separate <year>.nc.var files every year output. Use PEcAn.utils::nc_write_varfiles() create needed.

title: PEcAn.MAESPA 1.7.4
text: PEcAn.MAESPA now distributed BSD three-clause license instead NCSA Open Source license.

title: PEcAn.MAESPA 1.7.4
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Prior point changes tracked main CHANGELOG PEcAn repository.
